title: Shapeshifting
label: Paper Bag
description: After a few lackluster indie records, this Montreal group decamp to Paper Bag Records for a pulsing, lush LP produced by Studio's Dan Lissvik.

title: James Blake
label: A&M
description: After a brilliant run of EPs, James Blake returns with an album that tilts toward traditional songwriting while refining his unique approach to production.

title: Hello
label: Hello Echo
description: Apollo Sunshine guitarist Sean Aylward heads this indie trio, whose debut LP finds tension between the pastoral and the urban.

title: The Babies
label: Shrimper
description: This side project of Woods' bassist Kevin Morby and Cassie Ramone of Vivian Girls veers between exceeding the sum of its parts and falling far short.

title: Violet Cries
label: Matador
description: Matador's entry into the 2011 goth-pop sweepstakes enlists the xx producer Rodaidh McDonald for their highly anticipated debut LP.

title: HONORS
label: Sounds Familyre
description: Husband and wife indie-folk duo inject actions and situations that might seem banal with wonder and intrigue.

title: Step in Shadows
label: Young Turks
description: After remixing M.I.A., Basement Jaxx, Mark Ronson, and Underworld, this masked producer unleashes his latest pan-electronic LP.

title: Rare Forms
label: Lefse
description: Taking quite a few cues from Feels-era Animal Collective, this Lefse band delivers its sophomore album.

title: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light 1
label: Southern Lord
description: After two more personnel changes-- including the addition of Karl Blau on bass-- Earth return with a fresh context and complex, counterintuitive choices.

title: Zonoscope
label: Modular
description: Three years on from In Ghost Colours, Cut Copy return with a powerful new album that's less about anthems and more about movements and transitions.

title: Friends For Now
label: Kanine
description: One of a few bands aiming to replace Women as the go-to group for shadowy, reverb-smothered guitar rock unleashes its debut LP.

title: Until the Light of Morning
label: Light of Morning
description: New York-based English singer-songwriter offers an album of lullabies crafted for her new-parent friends.

title: Stars Have Shapes
label: Delmark
description: The collective led by trumpeter/cornetist Rob Mazurek returns with a heady mix of free and traditional jazz, ambient electronics, and musique concrète.

title: Wuppdeckmischmampflow
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's latest mix is less about the Now as it is just plain gorgeous, a wonderful slice of richly detailed home-listening techno.

title: Young the Giant
label: Roadrunner
description: Debut from California quintet seems like a label's calculated effort to capture indie rock's sound and commercial momentum yet include none of its spirit.

title: Rolling Blackouts
label: Memphis Industries
description: Brighton's the Go! Team show signs of evolution on album #3, as their stylistic range broadens ever so slightly.

title: We Are the Lilies
label: V2
description: Os Mutantes' Sérgio Dias teams with 70s pop revivalists Tahiti Boy and the Palmtree Family for an album that appropriates both musicians' styles.

title: Party Store
label: In the Red
description: Detroit garage-rock fixtures unleash a ballsy concept album that finds them covering some of their city's many classic techno songs.

title: Little Joy
label: Temporary Residence
description: Australian band's third album (first in America) splits the difference between krautrock, post-rock, and aggressive post-punk.

title: Tryptych
label: Modern Love
description: This heavy and rewarding set of dark, beat-driven ambience gathers three EPs released in 2010 and adds a healthy amount of bonus material.

title: Inès
label: Clown & Sunset
description: Young producer Nicolas Jaar issues a sharp collection from his Clown & Sunset imprint that offers intriguing new horizons in minimal.

title: Spiritual, Mental, Physical
label: Drag City
description: After unearthing a legit lost classic in Detroit garage rock band Death's 2009 collection, For the Whole World to See, Drag City offers a sequel.

title: Light Years
description: Producers Eliot Lipp and Leo 123 team up for a forceful and varied set that draws on various strands of electro.

title: Talk About Body
label: IAMSOUND
description: Le Tigre's JD Samson teams with friends Michael O'Neill and Ginger Brooks Takahashi for her first post-LT full-length release.

title: The Glow Remixes EP
label: RJ's Electrical Connections
description: The indie hip-hop star has his work remixed in ways that touch on a few of recent dance music's more ubiquitous trends.

title: Hexadecagon
label: Peek-A-Boo
description: Originally an installation alongside art by Dazed and Confused's Wiley Wiggins, these pieces now form the new LP from the Austin instrumentalists.

title: Pop Ambient 2011
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's annual Pop Ambient entry features regulars Wolfgang Voigt, Thomas Fehlmann, and Jürgen Paape, plus Alva Noto and Blixa Bargeld.

title: The Year of Magical Drinking
label: Merge
description: Former Broken West frontman Ross Flournoy returns with a rootsy new project and a collection of songs shaded with darkness.

title: Dance to the Best of ESG
label: Fire
description: 2xCD compilation documents the career of the South Bronx sister act who became a major influence on hip-hop, dance music, and dance-punk.

title: Blue Songs
label: Moshi Moshi
description: Andrew Butler returns, sans DFA, sans Antony, and sans the rich sound of 1970s disco, with a record built on the principles of Chicago house circa 1987.

title: Mend
label: self-released
description: This guitar-based ambient project from Will Wiesenfeld of Baths demonstrates the range of his interests and skill in a very different sphere.

title: The Party Ain't Over
label: Nonesuch
description: Dynamic rock'n'roll lifer and all-around live force Wanda Jackson follows Loretta Lynn's path and has a comeback LP produced by Jack White.

title: White Wilderness
label: Dead Oceans
description: The veteran singer-songwriter sets aside his meticulous studio approach for a quickly recorded album with orchestral arrangements.

title: Ventriloquizzing
label: Yep Roc
description: British quartet enlist the help of Devendra Banhart/Vetiver compatriot Thom Monahan to produce their third album of krautrock-inflected dance pop.

title: Hello Paradise
label: Friends
description: Latest album from Baltimore cabaret-punk trio finds them departing the label structure and releasing their new tunes as name-your-price mp3s.

title: Grown Unknown
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Brooklyn singer-songwriter makes her Jagjaguwar debut, adding meatier bursts of guitar and percussion to her balladry. Bon Iver's Justin Vernon guests.

title: Napa Asylum
label: Drag City
description: With its short, sharp blasts of noise and inviting hooks, this is possibly the best full-length so far from the raucous garage rock outfit.

title: Deerhoof vs. Evil
label: Polyvinyl
description: A transitional record, Deerhoof's latest finds them sidling up to the kind of heavy rock that's been their secret weapon in the past.

title: Lives and Treasure
label: Friendly Fire
description: This Brooklyn-based indie pop duo debuted in 2009 with the Chris Taylor-produced All of the Fire and now return with their full-length debut.

title: Mine Is Yours
label: Interscope
description: Blogrock stars make a bid for crossover success on their latest LP, enlisting the producer behind the past two Kings of Leon LPs.

title: Content
label: Yep Roc
description: The legendary post-punk band's songs on the financial and psychological toll of consumerism take on new meaning in the Internet era.

title: Gutter Rainbows
label: Javotti
description: The indie rap legend returns with an LP created, assembled, and channeled through means completely independent of the mainstream record industry.

title: Return of the Century
label: Parasol
description: Chicago indie band borrows its urbane sound from Belle & Sebastian and Brill Building pop but matches that with tough, sexually candid sentiments.

title: New Slaves Part II: Essence Implosion!
label: Social Registry
description: Avant-rock band offers its most varied album yet for the remix treatment, providing its hard, expansive songs with new angles and layers.

title: Cloud Nothings
label: Wichita
description: Like Wavves, this basement lo-fi hero continues to clean up nicely, offering deceptively dense and increasingly clearer power-pop.

title: Kiss Each Other Clean
label: 4AD
description: Building on the full-band work of 2007's The Shepherd's Dog, Sam Beam's latest is in some ways even more ambitious than its predecessor.

title: Unlearn
label: Hardly Art
description: Texas duo's debut album blends doo-wop, British folk, and garage rock with the group's arch sense of humor.

title: Not Yet
label: Drag City
description: Israeli trio known for their circus-style performances craft a third album for Drag City that fails to match the energy or chaos of their live shows.

title: There Are Rules
label: Quality Hill
description: For their latest album, the Kansas City emo outfit again drafts the help of producer Bob Weston (Mission of Burma, Shellac).

title: Kaputt
label: Merge
description: Dan Bejar returns with a brilliant and accessible album that draws from the lush sounds of the early 1980s but never forgets the importance of songwriting.

title: The Heart of the Nightlife
label: This Is Music
description: The band's name is Kisses. No points for guessing they're cute, swoony, boy-girl synth-pop.

title: Space City Kicks
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: At times raucous and rude and at others lovely and ornate, the most sonically lush Robert Pollard release in some time is also one of his more eclectic.

title: Remixes
label: Nonesuch
description: The Malian duo hand off songs from their recent records for remixes that include contributions from Akon, Miike Snow, and Vitalic.

title: Mantic
label: Apartment Life
description: The full-length debut from this Georgia-based singer-songwriter touches on the atmosphere and intimacy of artists like Grouper and Cat Power.

title: In the Cool of the Day
label: Sub Pop
description: Kentucky-born singer-songwriter performs gospel by memory, impressionistically, as shaped by his feelings on spirituality now. Jim James guests.

title: Ritual
label: Fiction
description: London band returns for album number two, and the record manages to be both wildly overwrought and painfully dull.

title: Cape Dory
label: Fat Possum
description: Husband/wife indie pop duo follow a string of well-liked blog mp3s with their nostalgia-soaked, Brill Building-referencing LP.

title: Dungeon Dots
label: Underwater Peoples
description: On her full-length debut, Brooklyn-based songwriter Nicole Schneit wrings a range of feelings from simple, ramshackle guitar pop.

title: Light of a Vaster Dark
label: Drag City
description: Faun Fables' provocative fifth album keys on writers likes Willa Cather and Laura Ingalls Wilder to explore the role of women in the early American Midwest.

title: Hilarious
label: Comedy Central
description: Coming off a banner professional year, veteran comedian unleashes another stand-up record of self-deprecation and locating absurdity in the seemingly mundane.

title: Behold the Spirit
label: Tompkins Square
description: This Nashville based guitarist, a member of Lambchop who has worked with Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Silver Jews, and more, has crafted a stunning solo debut.

title: Native Speaker
label: Kanine
description: Promising and fast-rising group brings a sense of drama and lust and elliptical, unexpected arrangements to indie rock.

title: Anika
label: Stones Throw
description: Portishead's Geoff Barrow and his side project Beak> back European chanteuse Anika on a mix of covers and originals.

title: Guider
label: Kranky
description: The Chicago psych-rock outfit lets loose with heavy krautrock-style repetition on their second full-length.

title: Emerald Fantasy Tracks
label: Magic Wire Recordings
description: On his second full-length, the UK producer crafts an instrumental LP that is a powerful mix of warped and disorienting melodies and clattering beats.

title: Dye It Blonde
label: Fat Possum
description: On their second full-length outing, the young Chicago band has delivered on their early promise, with a richer sound and a better batch of songs.

title: A New Way to Pay Old Debts
label: Editions Mego
description: Former Harry Pussy guitarist returns from a decade-long hiatus with a set of acoustic improvisations that recalls the best of his electric guitar work.

title: Blood Bunny / Black Rabbit
label: Temporary Residence
description: After a decade of refinement and improvement, the indie band offers a textbook placeholder EP: three new songs and a clutch of five remixes.

title: Ghost Blonde
label: Mexican Summer
description: This Montreal-based band touches on shoegaze and other 1990s signifiers but manages to craft a melodic squall all its own.

title: The King Is Dead
label: Rough Trade
description: Colin Meloy and co. follow their proggy rock opera The Hazards of Love with a breezy country-folk record. Peter Buck and Gillian Welch guest.

title: Is Growing Faith
label: Woodsist
description: Garage fixture Tim Presley (Darker My Love, the Strange Boys) continues to explore his psychedelic folk-rock side with his solo project, White Fence.

title: Imaginary Softwoods
label: Digitalis
description: Emeralds' John Elliott releases one of the mellowest, gentlest offerings yet from the Cleveland drone band's extended family.

title: By the Hedge
label: Captured Tracks
description: This Boston band surveys a range of indie pop and shoegaze sounds on its debut full-length and seems to have listened well.

title: The ONE... COHESIVE
label: Slow Motion Soundz
description: Continuing their remarkably consistent run, the Alabama rap duo returns with a lush and detailed full-length that builds on its predecessors.

title: Bardo Pond
label: Fire
description: Unsung Philly band is still plugging away through umpteen years and lineup changes, here offering a distillation of their many strengths.

title: Kitsuné Maison 10: The Fireworks Issue
label: Kitsuné
description: Latest Kitsuné comp forgoes the obvious heatseeking of recent entries for a collection of relative unknowns and stand-bys.

title: The Soft Moon
label: Captured Tracks
description: Imposing and stark, the Soft Moon's Captured Tracks debut is impressively bathed in the tension and gloom of the industrial and goth 1980s.

title: Red Barked Tree
label: Pinkflag
description: The latest from the re-reformed post-punk superstars shows the band's vigor, melodic prowess, and capacity to surprise remain undiminished.

title: A Young Person's Guide to Kyle Bobby Dunn
label: Low Point
description: One of the leading drone artists of recent years offers this massive, two-hour, 12-song cycle of drones and textures.

title: Bangs & Works, Vol. 1: A Chicago Footwork Compilation
label: Planet Mu
description: The Chicago-based footwork scene gets its first comprehensive compilation, and it serves as a very solid overview of the dance music style.

title: Valhalla Dancehall
label: Rough Trade
description: Ambitious to a fault, British Sea Power return with another record that aims to marry both their quirkier sensibilities and arena-level hooks.

title: Blurry Blue Mountain
label: Fire
description: Roughly a quarter-century into its life, Howe Gelb's Giant Sand project continues to display his command of songwriting and melodic vocabulary.

title: The Best of N.E.R.D.
label: Virgin
description: Drawing only from two albums, this "best of" is made even more pointless by the fact that its highlights all come from the In Search Of... LP.

title: Stay Home
label: Captured Tracks
description: New York band whose shoddy recording quality stood out in a crowded field of lo-fi acts presents a sophomore LP that cleans up their sound... a little.

title: Undressed EP
label: Thrill Jockey
description: A limited four-track EP from the Baltimore band finds them expanding their sound with some strings to intriguing effect.

title: Giza EP
label: Merok
description: Recalling Cabaret Voltaire and the darker strains of Detroit techno, Gatekeeper offer an eerie and entrancing slab of carefully reconstituted 80s synths.

title: Outside
label: Ibid
description: After an ill-advised sophomore release helmed by Dave Fridmann, the Minnesota band return to self-releasing, self-producing, and indie rock homage.

title: Live at Ancienne Belgique
label: self-released
description: After the hit-and-miss of Odd Blood, this free live set finds Yeasayer reining in their jammier tendencies and coming off as strident populists.

title: Soft Landing
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: Band with members of Beirut craft some lightweight tunes heavy on embellishment, with touches of Tropicália, mariachi, samba, and Balearic beat.

title: Love Letter
label: Jive
description: After a few bad records built more on eccentricities and outlandishness than craft and talent, R. Kelly returns to his roots and to form.

title: The Wants
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Patient and offbeat, this Scottish band works with the ornate like fellow Brits Elbow or the Divine Comedy and unexpected arrangements like These New Puritans.

title: The River EP
label: Rvng Intl.
description: Mike Silver follows his underrated debut LP of mostly instrumental electro-pop and a scattershot remix EP with this more contemporary-feeling release.

title: The Fall
label: EMI
description: A free Christmas release, billed as "the World's First iPad Album", this nice marketing gimmick is the result of Damon Albarn's restlessness on tour.

title: Silver
label: Kanine
description: Taking a minimal approach to jangly post-punk and dream-pop, this Virginia duo fits in line with past tourmates like Best Coast and the Dum Dum Girls.

title: Floored By Four
label: Chimera
description: Underground rock supergroup featuring Mike Watt, Wilco's Nels Cline, and Cibo Matto's Yuka Honda explore avant-garde improvisation.

title: Kompilation
label: Kompakt Klassiks
description: Despite a lack of prolificness, Kompakt co-founder Jürgen Paape has been one of its most defining architects; now his decade of work is finally collected.

title: Donnie G: Don Gorilla
label: Def Jam
description: The third member of Jadakiss and Styles P's the LOX makes an unlikely debut on the iconic Def Jam label.

title: Life of Love
label: Western Vinyl
description: This Brooklyn-via-NOLA trio crafts songs that do everything but what you'd expect, making this a rewarding listen from a quietly spectacular ensemble.

title: Death Seat
label: Young God
description: Under the auspices of Swans mastermind and Young God Records owner Michael Gira, James Jackson Toth re-records an improved set of old songs.

title: III/IV
label: Pax-Am
description: Adams is prolific to a fault, but this collection of outtakes from the sessions that produced 2007's Easy Tiger is better than one might expect.

title: Seeds
label: Mute
description: The Knife supplement one of 2010's most disorienting hard lefts-- their Charles Darwin-inspired opera-- with this brief remix EP.

title: She Was Coloured In
label: Planet Mu
description: Ireland's Solar Bears combine spacey retro sci-fi textures with glimmers of songcraft on their appealing full-length debut.

title: Worry
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: New Jersey band that shares a member with Ducktails debuts with a solid album of grinding noise pop.

title: Apollo Kids
label: Def Jam
description: After the all-R&B, mostly-WTF? direction of Ghostdini, Ghostface returns to hardcore rap with this all-star-boosted record.

title: Autre Ne Veut
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: This mysterious project combines elements of bygone R&B with avant-pop strangeness but never forgets the importance of song construction.

title: Night Slugs Allstars, Volume 1
label: Night Slugs
description: Home to Girl Unit, L-Vis 1990, Jam City, and Bok Bok, Night Slugs increasingly looks like the most exciting thing in UK dance music; hear why now.

title: No Mercy
label: Atlantic
description: Instead of a triumphant, post-prison redemption tale, T.I.'s latest is yet another introspective work. Kanye West, Drake, Eminem, and Scarface guest.

title: Golden Haze EP
label: Captured Tracks
description: Wild Nothing completes his big year by collecting the previously available Evertide EP, a Gemini B-side, and two new tracks.

title: Fire Like This
label: V2
description: UK riffs-and-rhythm duo get their first U.S. exposure with their latest album indebted to 90s-era heroes Fugazi, Drive Like Jehu, and Nirvana.

title: Land and Fixed
label: Captured Tracks
description: Lo-fi band led by Captured Tracks boss Mike Sniper ups its sonic fidelity, a bold step that better highlights the band's wanderlust and eclecticism.

title: Chandelier
label: Room40
description: Tokyo-based Rie Mitsutake assembles vividly mic'd piano, acoustic guitar, and off-kilter percussion into languidly immersive sound worlds.

title: Wild Go
label: Supply and Demand
description: Trafficking in pristine chamber pop, light on hooks but heavy on stark atmosphere, this band's new LP was produced by Low collaborator Tom Herbers.

title: Public Service Announcement
label: Woodsist
description: Philly-based artist who also plays in Birds of Maya releases an album of warped and raw guitar-pop experimentation.

title: Kokning
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: The Norwegian producer continues to refine his highly appealing blend of dub, cosmic disco, house, and Balearic sounds.

title: Quest for the Sonic Bounty
label: Tempa
description: Decade-old UK production team who are practically responsible for the phrase "dubstep" revisit the genre on their first LP in six years.

title: Marrow of the Spirit
label: Profound Lore
description: Agalloch peerlessly combine two ends of black metal-- the orchestral grandiosity of newer bands and the blistering pace of the old guard.

title: Shore Obsessed
label: Post Present Medium
description: Member of Lightning Bolt and Black Dice offers his second album as Soft Circle, this time with shorter, tighter dance songs.

title: Duettes
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: The bassist from Black Kids recruits vocalists from Camera Obscura, Vivian Girls, and Hefner for an indie pop EP that sounds nothing like Black Kids.

title: Zeus EP
label: Rough Trade
description: The Brighton band puts out an overstuffed EP in advance of their upcoming full-length and struggles to balance songwriting and bombast.

title: Go Live
label: self-released
description: Sigur Rós frontman documents his first solo foray with this CD/DVD package, which features an array of non-LP material.

title: As Stowaways in Cabinets of Surf, We Live-out in Our Members a Kind of Rebirth
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Singer-songwriter John Ringhofer, who has toured in Sufjan Stevens' band, issues an album of dense and tricky folk-pop.

title: Farad: The Electric Voice
label: Stones Throw
description: An eccentric, vocoder-building electronic forefather gets the reissue treatment from the fanatics at Stones Throw.

title: Legend Recognize Legend
label: Doomtree
description: Another Minneapolis musician navigates the divide between indie rock and indie hip-hop; this time it's ex-Plastic Constellations leader Aaron Mader.

title: Body Talk
label: Interscope
description: Compiling tunes from the two early Body Talk mini-LPs and adding worthy new material, Robyn ends a great year on a high note.

title: Fifteen
label: HoZac
description: Melbourne guitar/drums duo crafts a promising full-length debut, mixing garage-punk energy with nods to heavier alt-rock.

title: Restless People
label: IAMSOUND
description: Members of Tanlines and compatriots from Professor Murder create a celebratory, synth-heavy blend of Caribbean/world beat sounds.

title: The Voice of Lightness, Vol. 2
label: Sterns Africa
description: Picking up where the outstanding comp Voice of Lightness left off, this 2xCD set finds the Congolese rumba great mastering the driving sound of soukous.

title: Delicacies
label: Delicacies
description: After an all-star pop album, SMD regroup with a 2xCD record of tech-house instrumentals based around slow builds, minimal melodies, and negative space.

title: Magic Central
label: Hometapes
description: Latest album from this Michigan trio sounds gregarious and expansive in its eccentricities, which can range from charming to pushy.

title: Fan No. 2
label: Monika
description: Barbara Morgenstern, one of the leading architects of blending indie pop with techno, issues a 2xCD early works compilation and best-of set.

title: Hearts on Hold
label: City Slang
description: The leader of indie rock band 31Knots teams with folkie Corrina Repp for a project that's not simply the sum of their parts.

title: Parallel Seismic Conspiracies EP
label: Merge
description: Power-pop artist follows his debut with a new EP and a tilt toward the lo-fi, including covers of Guided by Voices and pre-Joy Division band Warsaw.

title: As U Were
label: Decon
description: The veteran Bay Area MC adds a little pop sparkle to a diverse collection of new songs.

title: Lina
label: Carpark
description: Toro Y Moi's Chaz Bundick continues to show his dance bona fides on this 12" of Italo disco, house, and retrofitted roller boogie.

title: Burning Bush Supper Club
label: Cantora
description: MGMT friends and tourmates finally unveil their debut LP of overdubbed psychedelica, reverb, and ramshackle rhythms.

title: Off Duty EP
label: Woodsist
description: Sun Araw follows one of the best psych records of the year with a three-track 12" that is expanded to five on the CD EP version.

title: Pink Friday
label: Universal Motown
description: One of the most exciting new voices in hip-hop makes her proper full-length debut, doing a lot of singing and not nearly enough rapping.

title: Loud
label: Def Jam
description: After responding to staggering emotional and physical trauma with the melodramatic Rated R, Rihanna returns to making effervescent pop.

title: Pretty Hate Machine
label: Interscope
description: The landmark debut by Trent Reznor's band is reissued, with new mastering overseen by Reznor and longtime engineer Tom Baker and an additional B-side.

title: Come and Get It: The Best of Apple Records
label: Apple
description: One-disc singles compilation, spanning 1968-1972, compiles some of the output of the Beatles' adventurous imprint, from Badfinger to James Taylor.

title: Mighty EP
label: self-released
description: L.A.-via-Michigan singer-songwriter spins familiar elements (sun-kissed harmonies, a tropical lilt, lots of reverb) into something personal and evocative.

title: March to the Sea
label: Skin Graft
description: Prog-punk can often come off like an exercise, but with AIDS Wolf it sounds more inspired than clinical, less a stylistic choice than a calling.

title: Heart Ache & Dethroned
label: Hydra Head
description: Justin Broadrick's latest release gathers the previously unreleased four-track EP, Dethroned, and Heart Ache, Jesu's long out-of-print debut.

title: Atlas Air EP
label: Virgin
description: Massive Attack end their year with a remix EP featuring DFA's Tim Goldsworthy and Jneiro Jarel.

title: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
label: Def Jam
description: Kanye's big year culminates in an LP that feels like an instant greatest hits, the ultimate realization of his strongest talents and divisive public persona.

title: The Weight's on the Wheels
label: Upper Class
description: After five years without a studio album, Matthew Adam Hart's indie pop project returns with a new record that showcases his complex, knotty lyrics.

title: Glass Eights
label: Dial
description: The Berlin-based American deep house producer follows a string of well received 12"s with his full-length debut.

title: Infected EP
label: Ninja Tune
description: Kevin Martin reintroduces his Bug project-- a mix of dancehall and London bass music-- with a double 12" that features Roots Manuva and Autechre.

title: Coals to Newcastle
label: Domino
description: The Scottish post-punk band's new box set isn't just a lavish retrospective, it's the complete Orange Juice.

title: New Love
label: Upset the Rhythm
description: Band led by Freddy Ruppert and featuring controbutions from Zola Jesus and Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart steps out for its second full-length.

title: We Love
label: Bpitch Control
description: Italian electro-pop duo releases its Bpitch Control debut, which is at its best more intimate, minimal, and full of sexual tension than it sounds.

title: Complete Mythology
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group craft this labor of love: four CDs, plus six LPs of the same material, and an extensive booklet celebrating this forgotten Chicago soulman.

title: Man on the Moon II: The Legend of Mr. Rager
label: GOOD
description: After the two-dimensional art-school-kid clichés of Man on the Moon, kiD CuDi partially makes good on his promise to loosen up his music.

title: Broken Dreams Club EP
label: True Panther
description: The SF band follows its 2009 Album with an equally strong collection of songs and more refined production, and they still know a lot about heartbreak.

title: Confusion
label: Power Tool
description: Young New Zealand band swipes moves from the Clean's playbook, just as indie rock acts from Yo La Tengo to Jay Reatard have in the past.

title: Golden Week for the Poco Poco Beat
label: Fool's Gold
description: Fool's Gold's Japanese all-girl band crafts a wickedly diverse LP, eschewing the noise or infantilism that tends to characterize exported Japanese pop music.

title: Magnetic Man
label: Columbia
description: Dubstep supergroup featuring Benga and Skream sets formal innovation aside to try on a variety of pop guises.

title: Forget the Mantra
label: Secretly Canadian
description: War on Drugs bassist shelves the reverb- and drone-heavy excursions of his dayjob for a bedroom recording experiment of hazy, morning-after songs.

title: History of Modern
description: One of the truly great bands in synth-pop history makes a comeback alongside the many bands currently aping their early 1980s sounds.

title: Worth the Weight: Bristol Dubstep Classics
label: Punch Drunk
description: Dubstep's Second City, Bristol, is surveyed in this mix by Peverelist and his Punch Drunk label. Artists include Joker, Guido, Appleblim, Hyetal, and Pinch.

title: Quarters
label: Fourthcity
description: The chiptune band focuses more on craftsmanship than showmanship on its second LP but still creates something unmistakably fun and its own.

title: Captured Anthems For an Empty Bathtub / Anthems For the Could've Bin Pills
label: Arts & Crafts
description: These reissues tell the story of a unit that featured Charles Spearin, a pre-Broken Social Scene Kevin Drew, and others in the BSS fold.

title: Tapes
label: !K7
description: The Big Pink's Milo Cordell uses this second entry in !K7's Tapes series to offer a mix of witch house and dubstep.

title: London Sessions
label: EMI
description: An in-studio set featuring nine songs plucked from LCD's entire career, London Sessions captures one of the greatest live bands out there in top form.

title: Radioclit Presents: The Sound of Club Secousse
label: Crammed Discs
description: The production team behind the Very Best assembles a party-ready collection of electronic dance music from Africa.

title: Nothing Fits
label: In the Red
description: Detroit-based basement punks head into an actual studio and embrace classic hardcore sounds for their latest LP.

title: BLACKENEDWHITE
label: self-released
description: Odd Future's first nod toward accessibility is still another fascinating, bizarre, expectation-defying piece of work.

title: How to Live
label: LOAF
description: With members from Broadcast and Plone, this UK band combines early synth adventures, psychedelic rock, experimental electronic film and TV scores.

title: Electric Sunset
label: K
description: Former frontman for the recently disbanded Desolation Wilderness returns and takes steps into more energetic and engaging territory.

title: Sports
label: Slumberland
description: This San Francisco noise-pop trio make one of the most promising indie rock records of the year.

title: The Best of Suede
label: Suede Limited
description: This 2xCD set gathers together the Britpop band's singles on one disc, with another well-chosen disc of album tracks and B-sides.

title: Ironto Special
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Jack Rose collaborators continue to make smart, studious music in the vein of various Appalachian sounds, from folk to bluegrass.

title: Litanies
label: Woodsist
description: Like many current Bay Area bands, this trio draws from the noisier, freaked-out side of jangly 60s garage.

title: Pyramid of the Sun
label: Temporary Residence
description: The instrumental band has shifted to the spacey, proggy territory of Zombi, aided greatly by the skill of late drummer Jerry Fuchs.

title: Tradi-Mods vs. Rockers: Alternative Takes on Congotronics
label: Crammed Discs
description: Crammed Discs asks 26 non-African artists-- including Animal Collective, Andrew Bird, Deerhoof, Oneida, and Shackleton-- to take on Congotronics.

title: Funeral Mariachi
label: Abduction
description: After close to 30 years and something in the vicinity of 50 albums, this is apparently the final studio record by the uncategorizable trio Sun City Girls.

title: LATE EP
label: Woodsist
description: Following a sprawling live set, one of experimental music's most dependably unconventional acts issues a series of short textural explorations.

title: Ardour
label: Brainfeeder
description: Producer on Flying Lotus' Brainfeeder imprint has an uncanny knack for sculpting organic-sounding beats.

title: WYWH
label: Friendly Fire
description: Again pressing on without the distinctive presence of former frontwoman Victoria Bergsman, the Concretes return with an LP that arguably need not exist.

title: Special Affections
label: Secret City
description: Transforming into a glam-synth creation, this former indie rocker fascinatingly steps outside of his own comfort zone, both musically and emotionally.

title: Gutter Water
label: Decon
description: Cinematic NYC mainstream rap producer teams with the stalwart Stones Throw rapper/producer to crank a weird little record.

title: Live in Japan
label: Editions Mego
description: A new disc of laptop-based improvisation from Jim O'Rourke, Christian Fennesz, and Peter Rehberg, collecting live performances from 2009.

title: Castle Talk
label: Don Giovanni
description: One of the more exciting punk acts around, this NJ band's musical vocabulary ranges from classic rock to hardcore to new wave to indie to lo-fi.

title: Margins
label: Billingham
description: Following the Killers' Brandon Flowers and Bloc Party's Kele, another 2000s post-punk revivalist-- Maxïmo Park's Paul Smith-- offers a solo LP.

title: Swim Remixes
label: Merge
description: The exploratory nature of Dan Snaith's sound is reworked by Junior Boys, Gold Panda, Nite Jewel, DJ Koze, and more on this remix LP.

title: Clairaudience Fellowship
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Baltimore neighbors Twig Harper and Daniel Higgs are so creatively aligned it's a wonder that the two abstractionists haven't worked together before.

title: Nothing
label: Star Trak
description: Typically a clearinghouse for Pharrell's bad ideas, an N.E.R.D. record again serves as a parade of deliriously off impulses.

title: Come Around Sundown
label: RCA
description: After playing imaginary rock stars for years, Kings of Leon finally found success. And they follow that with a sense of victimhood.

title: The Bootleg Series, Vol. 9: The Witmark Demos: 1962-1964
label: Columbia
description: This set collects 47 songs from early in Dylan's career, some of which are receiving their first proper release.

title: Codename: Rondo
label: Trashy Moped
description: The Austin duo's fourth album fails as both humor and pop music.

title: Adolescent Funk
label: Stones Throw
description: This recent collection sheds light on the electro-funk star's underheard formative years, focusing on demos and hometapes from 1988 through 1992.

title: Small Craft on a Milk Sea
label: Warp
description: Two institutions of electronic music, braininess, and design-- Brian Eno and Warp Records-- come together for their first-ever co-release.

title: All Night
label: Lefse
description: After a few well-received advance tracks, the ethereal Chicago duo emerges with their full-length debut.

title: Slime Flu
label: E1
description: Crewed up with a suddenly resurgent Cam'ron, this recently unknown NYC rapper has built serious momentum over the past year.

title: A Bureaucratic Desire for Extra-Capsular Extraction
label: Southern Lord
description: Southern Lord gathers together the tapes from the drone metal band's aborted first album, recorded in 1990, which include a contribution from Kurt Cobain.

title: Sidewalks
label: Fader
description: The beloved pop duo enlists rising producer Ben Allen to flesh out their bang-and-bash sound with more studio flourishes and varied instrumentation.

title: 24 Hour Karate School
label: Def Jam
description: The veteran producer emerges with his long-awaited and oft-delayed solo album, which includes contributions from Curren$y, Wiz Khalifa, and Jay Electronica.

title: Opticks
label: Fat Cat
description: Norweigian singer/songwriter follows her FatCat debut with another record of intimate, hypnotic, incredibly private music.

title: Amoral
label: Friendly Fire
description: With clean production, anthemic choruses, and no reverb, this band-- led by a Lansing-Dreiden member-- flies in the face of Brooklyn electro-pop fashion.

title: Spiral Shadow
label: Season of Mist
description: One of the best metal bands around proves its worth once again with another outstanding, crossover-friendly record of hooks and noise.

title: An Introduction To...
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Kill Rock Stars assembles a very solid single-disc overview of Smith's best work from his entire career.

title: What It Means to Be Left-Handed
label: Fat Cat
description: Adam Pierce's long-running and constantly evolving project moves into a more song-oriented direction while continuing to integrate influences from all over.

title: Future Weather EP
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Philly throwback rock band that birthed Kurt Vile releases an EP that displays new compositional strengths and flair for sonic texture.

title: The Appeal: Georgia's Most Wanted
label: Warner Bros.
description: After re-energizing gangsta rap, Gucci Mane aims at the charts on his latest album.

title: Jamie, My Intentions Are Bass EP
label: Warp
description: The dance-rock fixtures enlist Bibio, Tim Goldsworthy, and more for a (mostly) remix EP that actually improves on its source material.

title: Paupers Field
label: Rough Trade
description: Young Rough Trade signee makes gloom-and-doom Americana music that sounds well beyond his 20 years.

title: The Fool
label: Rough Trade
description: L.A. art-rock quartet's debut LP is a nine-song seance of an album that's as subtle as it is disquieting.

title: Port Entropy
label: P-Vine
description: This freakishly gifted Japanese bedroom-pop artist returns with more giddy, charming, two-dimensional music.

title: Nocturne of Exploded Crystal Chandelier
label: Dead Oceans
description: This Philly dream-pop band has a hazy sound that's all over indie these days but manages to stand out on the strength of its songwriting.

title: Flockaveli
label: Warner Bros.
description: Backed by Lex Luger's visceral production, Gucci Mane's protege strips street rap to its essential characteristics and distills the genre into its purest form.

title: Facit
label: Razzia
description: Unlikely Swedish pop star Annika Norlin, who also makes albums as Hello Saferide, returns with a well-crafted album under her Säkert! alias.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7
description: The fourth DJ-Kicks set of 2010 finds the German producer connecting dots between tracks by Thom Yorke, Burial and Four Tet, Joy Orbison, and more.

title: Authenticity
label: Foreign Exchange
description: Phonte and Nicolay continue in the vein of Leave It All Behind, crafting musically and emotionally sophisticated R&B.

title: Olympia
label: EMI
description: Once rumored to be a full-on Roxy Music album, Bryan Ferry's latest does feature original Roxy Music members Andy Mackay, Phil Manzanera, and Brian Eno.

title: Song Islands Vol. 2
label: P.W. Elverum & Sun
description: Another retrospective from Phil Elverum including 30-some tracks, primarily unreleased, covering everything from raw alternate takes to wormy 1970s AM pop.

title: Innundir Skinni
label: One Little Indian
description: Icelandic singer/songwriter continues to slowly earn a rep in America off the back of her quietly spellbinding Við Og Við and live shows.

title: The Naked Soul of Sweet Jones
label: Rap-A-Lot
description: The late UGK rapper, one of the foundations of Southern rap, has another record posthumously released.

title: New Chain
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Brooklyn band makes the jump to Jagjaguwar for the release of its debut album.

title: NYMPH
label: Social Registry
description: This underground psych band has its previously vinyl-only release issued on the dependable Social Registry label.

title: Down There
label: Paw Tracks
description: The Animal Collective member receives production help from bandmate Josh Dibb for his darkly intense solo full-length debut.

title: Riposte
label: Brassland
description: Brooklyn duo uses unusual instruments and quick-cut songwriting structures on their quirky and bracing debut.

title: The Inevitable Past Is the Future Forgotten
label: Temporary Residence
description: After more than a decade hiatus, the band that helped birth both Pinback and the Black Heart Procession returns with a small, well-earned triumph.

title: Is Fixed
label: Defend Music
description: The pop-dance duo known for big choruses and bright hooks crafts an unusually sinister DJ mix that explores house and techno's creepier impulses.

title: I Will Love You at All
label: Yep Roc
description: The Australian singer-songwriter who was in the Simpletons and worked with the Lucksmiths displays a fine sense of craft on latest solo LP.

title: Way Slow Volume One
label: Lefse
description: Lefse Records kicks off its Way Slow series of experiments, indulgences, and curios with a release from this London bedroom pop artist.

title: I Plan to Stay a Believer: The Inside Songs of Curtis Mayfield
label: AUM Fidelity
description: The influential jazz bassist assembles an ambitious tribute to the songs of Curtis Mayfield, featuring contributions from Amiri Baraka, Hamid Drake, and more.

title: Undercard
label: Merge
description: Mountain Goats' John Darnielle teams with Franklin Bruno for the first time in years, recording literary songs about people trapped in desperate circumstances.

title: The Hybrid
label: Rappers I Know
description: Following the lead of Royce da 5'9" and Elzhi, this rising Detroit rapper proves he's also one of underground rap's brightest young talents on his new LP.

title: Zeroes QC
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Montreal band makes a very promising start, blending prog's ambition with krautrock's precision. Besnard Lakes' Jace Lasek produces.

title: Death Gate EP
label: Brainfeeder
description: L.A. producer best known for his work on Gonjasufi's A Sufi and a Killer folds in music from across the spectrum on this distinctive EP.

title: $O$
label: Interscope
description: The weirdly fascinating South African outfit tries to make its rap-rave sound and conceptual underpinnings fit the LP format.

title: Patience
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: The veteran New Zealand noise band, as it had begun to on 2008's Secret Earth, returns to something close to rock music.

title: Last Chants
label: Babylon
description: The editor and co-founder of the impeccably hip The Pop Manifesto crafts an extremely well-produced, terrific-sounding record.

title: Living With Yourself
label: Editions Mego
description: Emeralds member steps out with a more accessible solo LP that traffics in memory and nostalgia to intriguing effect.

title: Shobaleader One: d’Demonstrator
label: Warp
description: Tom Jenkinson continues to hop through styles and sounds, here taking on French soft-rock, disco-pop, and techno-rock.

title: I Am the West
label: Lench Mob
description: Probably the least financially beneficial project he could be devoting himself to these days: Ice Cube issues an independent rap record.

title: Tall Hours in the Glowstream
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: On their second full-length, Cotton Jones take a more wistful and weary tone; the result sounds like classic country music filtered through dream-pop haze.

title: North
label: Hyperdub
description: Darkstar's full-length debut for Hyperdub finds them working more heavily with vocals and taking a turn toward synth-pop.

title: Autumn, Again
label: self-released
description: The Philly dream-pop band continues its creative streak with a self-released album that extends the blurry meldocism of Ashes Grammar.

title: Play It Strange
label: In the Red
description: Garage-pop band from the fertile San Francisco scene works with producer Tim Green on its strongest material to date.

title: Lawless Darkness
label: Season of Mist
description: Sweden's Watain once felt like a throwback to the wild early days of black metal, here they go for something bigger and possibly more accessible.

title: Home Sweet Mobile Home
label: Verve
description: Under her perky persona Nellie McKay has always hidden a prickly disposition, which comes out on her most intensely, intently melancholy album yet.

title: Lasted
label: Kranky
description: The third full-length is the best album yet from Thomas Meluch's dark and droney electro-acoustic folk project.

title: Life! Death! Prizes!
label: Where It's At Is Where You Are
description: UK band follows one of last year's best indie pop records with a new collection of scruffy, heartbroken, and genuinely communicative songs.

title: Every Step's a Yes
label: Fiction
description: Psych-folkers A Band of Bees (Bees outside the U.S.) craft a follow-up to 2007's Octopus that's even more mellow and spaced-out.

title: Swanlights
label: Secretly Canadian
description: On possibly his most demanding record to date, Antony Hegarty displays a half-dozen stylistic shifts, duets with Björk, and teams with Nico Muhly.

title: Ghost Fits
label: Narnack
description: Already entrenched in Brooklyn's DIY rock scene, the members of Sisters here make their noise-pop debut.

title: Face Tat
label: Sargent House
description: The prolific drummer here focuses as much on his oddball songs as his world-class musicianship. Devendra Banhart, Prefuse 73, and No Age guest.

title: The Caliph's Tea Party
label: Warp
description: Gonjasufi's multi-faceted vocals get the remix treatment from Oneohtrix Point Never, Broadcast and the Focus Group, and others.

title: Lucky Shiner
label: Ghostly
description: London bedroom producer follows a slew of excellent EPs and remixes with his much-anticipated Ghostly debut LP.

title: Foreign Landscapes
description: German pianist/composer follows his excellent 2008 album, Ferndorf, with an album of chamber and piano pieces inspired by various locales.

title: To Dreamers
label: Sub Pop
description: Stoltz's latest for Sub Pop finds him dressing down his pocket symphonies, throwing a little more grease and glam at his well-oiled tunes.

title: The Age of Adz
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Sufjan returns with a welcome change-up, as he moves away from bookish detail, experiments with electronics, and writes from a more personal perspective.

title: Graffiti Composition
label: Dog W/A Bone
description: The experimental craftsman teams here with Elliott Sharp for an improvised concert based on an abstract score, one crafted by graffiti on blank music sheets.

title: Holkham Drones
label: Border Community
description: Following fellow Border Community producers James Holden and Nathan Fake, this UK producer gently, effectively recalls Oval, Seefeel, and Cocteau Twins.

title: Last Day of Summer
label: Downtown
description: Austin band celebrates the end of summer with a free online release full of experiments, detours, and well-taken chances.

title: Blue Water White Death
label: Graveface
description: Xiu Xiu's Jamie Stewart and Shearwater's Jonathan Meiburg come together for a new project.

title: Write About Love
label: Matador
description: Settling into a chiming, mod-inflected version of 70s AM pop, the indie pop legends put the focus here on their ensemble playing and intricate arrangements.

title: Marcberg
label: Fat Beats
description: Rapper associated with Busta Rhymes' Flipmode Squad steps out with an album that combines early 1990s boom-bap with an impressive flair for storytelling.

title: Sailors With Wax Wings
label: Angel Oven
description: Helmed by Pyramids' R. Loren, this crew also features Prurient, James Blackshaw, Marissa Nadler, and members of Unwound, Slowdive, Swans, and Current 93.

title: An Ark for the Listener
label: Touch
description: One of experimental music's current stars, Jeck expertly mixes, loops, and layers passages from old records into an instantly identifiable aesthetic.

title: 1,000 Years
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Sleater-Kinney's banshee-wailing singer retreats to creating a record of surprisingly muted, slow-burning intimacy.

title: King Night
label: IAMSOUND
description: The witch house poster band's brand of slowed-down, blown-out, culturally mishmashed electronic music has proven divisive, but it was always meant to be.

title: Past Time
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: San Francisco-based post-punk group makes a solid second album thanks to its three distinct and spirited vocalists.

title: Wolfpack Party
label: The Pack Musick
description: Bloghouse-rap holdovers the Pack return after an unusally long layoff, bearing no resemblance to the meme-generating solo career of group member Lil B.

title: Epic
label: Ba Da Bing!
description: Sophomore album from this Brooklyn-via-Tennessee singer-songwriter improves on her debut with classical songwriting and a confident, ethereal delivery.

title: A Swedish Love Story EP
label: Domino
description: This sonic continuation of Heartland is a reflection of Pallett's new live setup, where the once solo star is now augmented by a multi-instrumentalist.

title: Marnie Stern
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Still balancing earnestness and technique, Marnie Stern's songs here are darker, the lyrics lingering on loss, regret, doubt, and failed love.

title: Solo
label: ACT Music + Vision
description: One of the most inventive and vital men in contemporary jazz, expert collaborator Vijay Iyer finally gets around to doing a solo piano LP.

title: Ring
label: True Panther
description: Alongside Bat for Lashes, Fever Ray, and Zola Jesus, Glasser is in the upper tier of those making quasi-mystical, swirling electro-pop.

title: oOoOO EP
label: Tri Angle
description: Witch-house/drag producer's debut EP drops a pin at the crossroads where commercially viable hip-hop gravitates toward left-field electronic influences.

title: Shadow Temple
label: Paw Tracks
description: Raw, unrestrained psych-rock band releases its fourth album, and first for Animal Collective's Paw Tracks label.

title: Meet Me at the Muster Station
label: Paper Bag
description: The full-length debut from this Ontario duo finds them putting a forceful and funny spin on the sound of 1980s indie rock.
